intro: Polygala heterotricha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milk-vetch, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellow or greenish-yellow flowers that are often clustered in spicate inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and linear, typically arranged alternately along the stem. Polygala heterotricha is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils.
